Class Controller

java.lang.Object
Controller
public class Controller
extends java.lang.Object
The Controller Class is the Controller of the Carbon Impact Application program and acts as the base of operation of the program, separating the View from the ActivityList. It listens for calls from the View class to receive user requests and communicate the requested operations to the Model.
Since:
18/03/2020
Author:
Justas Cepaitis * @version 1.0

  • Field Summary

    Fields 
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    (package private) ActivityList appModel
    The appModel is an Object of the AcitivityList class used by the Controller class to communicate with the ActivityList.

    This method returns the total points of a week of activities by calling the ActivityList method getTotalPoints() and storing its return value in an integer variable called total.

    This method returns the total points of all activities by calling the ActivityList method getTotalPointsOfAllWeeks() and storing its return value in an integer variable called total.

    This method utilizes serialization in order to save the existing activities entered by the user to a file called "activities.txt".

      ActivityList appModel

  • Constructor Details

    • Controller

      public Controller()

  • Method Details

    • addActivity

      public void addActivity​(int week, java.time.LocalDate date, java.lang.String name, int points)
      This method checks the points of the activity passed to it, ensuring it is no less than -10 and no greater than +10, outputting an appropriate message if activity did not meet requirement. If the activity meets requirements, the activity is passed to the Model class setActivity() method to add it to the list of activities.
      Parameters:
      week - . Week of activity
      date - . Date of activity
      name - . Name of activity
      points - . Points of activity

    • getActivity

      public Activity getActivity​(int week, java.time.LocalDate date, java.lang.String name, int points)
      This method returns an activity which corresponds to the entered parameters by calling the ActivityList getActivity() method .
      Parameters:
      week - . Week of activity
      date - . Date of activity
      name - . Name of activity
      points - . Points of activity
      Returns:
      Activity. The activity corresponding to the parameters passed.

    • getActivityByIndex

      public Activity getActivityByIndex​(int index)
      This method returns an activity by its index by calling the ActivityList method getActivityByIndex().
      Parameters:
      index - . Index states the position of the desired activity
      Returns:
      Activity. Returns an activity corresponding to specified index

    • getActivities

      public java.lang.String getActivities()
      This method returns a list of activities in String form by calling the ActivityList method getActivitiesText() and storing the output of the method in a String called text.
      Returns:
      String. Returns a \n separated String of activities

    • getActivitiesByDate

      public java.lang.String getActivitiesByDate()
      This method returns activities by date by calling the ActivityList method getActivitiesByDate().
      Returns:
      String. Returns a \n separated String of activities sorted by their dates

    • getActivitiesByActivity

      public java.lang.String getActivitiesByActivity()
      This method returns activities by name by calling the ActivityList method getActivitiesByActivity().
      Returns:
      String. Returns a \n separated String of activities sorted by their names

    • getNumberOfActivities

      public int getNumberOfActivities()
      This method returns the size of the list of activities in ActivityList by calling the ActivityList method getActivities().
      Returns:
      Int. Returns the number of activities

    • removeActivity

      public void removeActivity​(int Week, java.time.LocalDate Date, java.lang.String Name, int Points)
      This method removes an activity by passing the activity passed to it to the ActivityList removeActivity() method.
      Parameters:
      Week - . Week of the activity
      Date - . Date of the activity
      Name - . Name of the activity
      Points - . Points of the activity

    • getTotal

      public int getTotal​(int week)
      This method returns the total points of a week of activities by calling the ActivityList method getTotalPoints() and storing its return value in an integer variable called total.
      Parameters:
      week - . Week of activities to have their total points returned
      Returns:
      Int. The added up points of the week of activities

    • getTotalOfAllWeeks

      public int getTotalOfAllWeeks()
      This method returns the total points of all activities by calling the ActivityList method getTotalPointsOfAllWeeks() and storing its return value in an integer variable called total.
      Returns:
      Int. The added up points of all activities

    • saveToFile

      public void saveToFile()
      This method utilizes serialization in order to save the existing activities entered by the user to a file called "activities.txt". This method checks if the "activities.txt" file exists before operating, if the file exists, the file is recreated to clear its contents. the activities are loaded into the file using the ActivityList getActivities() method.

    • loadFromFile

      public void loadFromFile()
      This method utilizes serialization in order to load the activities from a file called "activities.txt". the activities are loaded into the list of activities in ActivityList by this method reading every object in the file line by line and calling the ActivityList setActivitiesFromFile() method to add each object to the list of activities
